page.title: 04Local Churches
page.content: The Church of England churches of Stanbridge and Tilsworth are incoporated in the North Chilterns Group of Parishes with Rev Canon Derek Cook as the incumbent. The Group Council meets four times annually for discussion. The church of St John the Baptist at Stanbridge has been greatly restored but contains an interesting inscribed stone boulder found in 1858 and is said to pre_date Christianity. An Early English font standing on three columns and some 17th Century woodwork make this an interesting church for the visitor. At All Saints Tilsworth there is a tombstone to the memory of an unknown girl who was murdered in the woods nearby. There are no chapels in either of these villages.
